argument.name: limit
argument.desc: how many end-tier factories to get

line.comment: * this script fixes a strategic ship component shortage of $race by recycling useless factories to build more important factories.
* a 'dumb' AI always wants to free up enough support slots for the entire product chain (the lower tier factories can only get built by Mayhem.Monitor.Autopopulate.Station)
* 'smart' AI skips lower tier factories if those resources are still plentyful available to buy from any trading station. (it free's up no additional station support slots)

line.text: ' production for it. And they plan to source from trading stations.'

line.comment: * how many additional ship component factories can we build at once to fix our shortage?
* AI being smart or not
* ^^^ an array of all 7 intermediate factory resources existing in Mayhem 3, ranked by general availability on all trading stations. Updated by ZH.distributeCorpResources
* ^^^ an array of any of the 7 resources which the galaxy desperately needs more of
* never build more than 4 end-tier factories per sector you own (in total)

line.text: ' . They could only get up to '

line.comment: * the following builds 1 additional ship component factory and either free enough station support slots to supply it with resources or not (self sufficient vs. external supply)
* how many station support slots do we need to free up?
* index 0-2 means that all trading stations probably still sell plenty of this resource, so if we are smart we don't build those factories at all
* go further down the product chain until you end up with the lowest tier resource (which should never run out)
* which of our current factories are not necessary?
* we also don't need the final tier factories of the ship component that we have the most of
* if we plan to import resources from company trading stations we should only recycle useless factories which are right next to them
* if we want to build the entire self sufficient product chain we should stay in one general area (roughly) and it should be close to one of our major sector clusters
* not a very strict jump range limit
* first get rid of the useless factory
* if it was a mine we return an asteroid back to the sector
* then build that critical ship component factory which you need to fix your shortage
* from Mayhem.Monitor.Autopopulate.Station
*$canBuild = [NULL]-> call script 'Mayhem.CanBuildStation' : sector=$buildableSector
*$canAfford = [NULL]-> call script 'Mayhem.CanAffordStation' : outpost=$outpost stationType=$type qty=1
*$posArray = [NULL]-> call script 'Joubarbe.Lib.GetValidPos' : sector=$buildableSector minDistance=0 posArray=null verticalOnly=[FALSE] refobj=null
* we don't want to check for enemies because at this point we always need to build the station
* $canPlace = [NULL]-> call script 'Mayhem.CanPlaceStation' : posArray=$posArray sector=$buildableSector stationOwner=$race stationType=$type
* couldn't find a trading station in own sector

this script fixes a strategic ship component shortage of $race by recycling useless factories to build more important factories.
a 'dumb' AI always wants to free up enough support slots for the entire product chain (the lower tier factories can only get built by Mayhem.Monitor.Autopopulate.Station)
'smart' AI skips lower tier factories if those resources are still plentyful available to buy from any trading station. (it free's up no additional station support slots)
how many additional ship component factories can we build at once to fix our shortage?
AI being smart or not
^^^ an array of all 7 intermediate factory resources existing in Mayhem 3, ranked by general availability on all trading stations. Updated by ZH.distributeCorpResources
^^^ an array of any of the 7 resources which the galaxy desperately needs more of
never build more than 4 end-tier factories per sector you own (in total)
the following builds 1 additional ship component factory and either free enough station support slots to supply it with resources or not (self sufficient vs. external supply)
how many station support slots do we need to free up?
index 0-2 means that all trading stations probably still sell plenty of this resource, so if we are smart we don't build those factories at all
go further down the product chain until you end up with the lowest tier resource (which should never run out)
which of our current factories are not necessary?
we also don't need the final tier factories of the ship component that we have the most of
if we plan to import resources from company trading stations we should only recycle useless factories which are right next to them
if we want to build the entire self sufficient product chain we should stay in one general area (roughly) and it should be close to one of our major sector clusters
not a very strict jump range limit
first get rid of the useless factory
if it was a mine we return an asteroid back to the sector
then build that critical ship component factory which you need to fix your shortage
from Mayhem.Monitor.Autopopulate.Station
$canBuild = [NULL]-> call script 'Mayhem.CanBuildStation' : sector=$buildableSector
$canAfford = [NULL]-> call script 'Mayhem.CanAffordStation' : outpost=$outpost stationType=$type qty=1
$posArray = [NULL]-> call script 'Joubarbe.Lib.GetValidPos' : sector=$buildableSector minDistance=0 posArray=null verticalOnly=[FALSE] refobj=null
we don't want to check for enemies because at this point we always need to build the station
$canPlace = [NULL]-> call script 'Mayhem.CanPlaceStation' : posArray=$posArray sector=$buildableSector stationOwner=$race stationType=$type
couldn't find a trading station in own sector
